for the voting phase:Live CountdownQuote from: RickDeckard on February 14, 2023, 12:00:01 AM(...)2nd Phase - Voting process from 15th of March to 29th of March (23:59:59 GMT). Winner shall be announced on the 31th of March.During this phase, users are only able to vote in 1 entry from the 1st Phase, but are free to edit their vote until the 2nd phase ends.No merit sending is allowed from nominees to users which nominated them(...)Voting form (Added 16/03/2023)To standarize the voting section, and after suggestion from the members, I kindly ask anyone edible for voting to use the following (simple) form:Code:Bitcointalk Account: (Insert your own account name here)My vote goes to: (Insert Bitcointalk account name)If you don't see your entry in this list don't hesitate to PM me and I'll take a look in it! The main reason will probably be that the requirements weren't met though.For more information regarding contest rules and prizes, please check the announcement thread.

comments.author: RickDeckard
comments.created_time: March 15, 2023, 12:11:55 AMLast edit: March 16, 2023, 08:58:04 PM by RickDeckard
comments.body: Changelog:Code:16/03/2023 - Added voting form and line break between submissions. Changed pictures of MK-74 (per PM request), loopes and babygun.

comments.author: acroman08
comments.body: hi, can I point out something, I think it would be good if you add a horizontal line between each submission because the name of the participants is too close to the image above them, it makes it looks like the image above them is the pie they submitted. good luck to all participants!!!

comments.author: AHOYBRAUSE
comments.created_time: March 15, 2023, 04:28:16 AMLast edit: March 15, 2023, 08:04:28 AM by AHOYBRAUSE
comments.body: Quote from: acroman08 on March 15, 2023, 02:17:55 AMhi, can I point out something, I think it would be good if you add a horizontal line between each submission because the name of the participants is too close to the image above them, it makes it looks like the image above them is the pie they submitted. good luck to all participants!!!I thought the same thing. It's a little confusing to figure out which name belongs to the picture.One more thing. How can people actually vote? Didn't see anything about that?Comment in this thread which submission they like most?Anyway, good luck to all the participants. I won't stand a chance against this strong competition! Respect!Edit: My vote goes to Helena Yu ( https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5439781.msg61770657#msg61770657 ) , she was the first and set the standard.

comments.body: I would like to vote for EFS ( https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5439781.msg61883586#msg61883586 )Good luck.BTW thanks to all participants. All looks delicious üòâ

comments.author: joker_josue
comments.created_time: March 15, 2023, 07:51:22 AMLast edit: March 23, 2023, 09:20:22 AM by joker_josue
comments.body: Excellent participations, many congratulations.It was clearly noted that many put in the effort and made beautiful pies.Bitcointalk Account: joker_josueMy vote goes to: MK-74EDIT: To adapt the vote to the format requested by the OP.@RickDeckardI would suggest between each entry to add:Code:[hr]And also give a little more space between each entry.The way it is currently, it can confuse the names and the images, since it seems that the name below the photos was the one that made the afternoon, and not the one above.

comments.body: Bitcointalk Account: CoinEraserMy vote goes to: AHOYBRAUSEGood luck to all participants. Nice to see that so many people took part in this competition.

comments.author: Erumo
comments.body: How can we decide who is the winner without tasting pies ?  For example Helena Yu pie looks tasty and I want to eat it. But some pies looks like they are raw and still need to be left for few minutes in oven.

comments.author: macson
comments.body: my voting fall to PowerGlovei like the simple pie made and the bitcoin logo that looks perfect must be very yummy.

comments.author: Becassine
comments.body: Hello, if you could post these images maybe ?

comments.author: jayce
comments.body: Perhaps we can vote 3? So many delicious pies there to be chosen

comments.author: GrosWesh
comments.body: So much nice cakes here¬† However , i want to give my vote to the friendly 'Becassine'

comments.author: Danydee
comments.body: There is no particular form for voting ?

comments.author: paid2
comments.body: Congrats to all the participants, a lot of beautiful things here !!!My vote 100% goes to Becassine !¬† Because yeah, a pie is not a cake, and apple pies are holy. I have to say that it is one of the most beautiful apple pie I saw until now. Pretty sad to not had the opportunity to taste it

comments.author: W Jr.
comments.body: There is a great competition with the pies, each of which looks more beautiful than the other. Thanks to all the members of the forum, from the organizer to the participant. I want to participate in the voting. The work I chose is the pie belonging to @EFS. I hope it will be a competition that will be repeated every year. Personal opinion: If we had the chance to vote more than once, we would have a chance to support more users My Vote goes to : EFS

comments.body: When will the bitcoin beef bourguignon or blanquette de veau contest be held?

comments.author: jeraldskie11
comments.body: There are so many delicious pies submitted above but I will choose for GazetaBitcoin's pie among them.I noticed that his pie is unique from the others, we can't even recognize that it's an apple pie, the chocolate filling also is so delicious.
